title: North Andover’s Jake Bobo ready to play ‘bad guy’ against hometown Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jake Bobo, Seattle Seahawks wide receiver, prepares to face his hometown team, the New England Patriots, in the Super Bowl.
Bobo is originally from North Andover and reminisces about attending Patriots' Super Bowl parades while wearing a Tom Brady jersey.
Despite reduced playing time this season, Bobo aims to contribute significantly in the upcoming game against the Patriots.

title: 10 Patriots takeaways from Super Bowl Opening Night
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye addressed concerns about his shoulder injury, stating he feels good and ready for Super Bowl LX.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel received praise from players for his impact on and off the field.
Super Bowl Opening Night saw lighthearted moments, with athletes discussing family, celebrity interactions, and personal interests.

title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, from Newton, is charged with multiple counts, including assault and unauthorized practice of medicine in Allston.
Wang allegedly performed unlicensed cosmetic surgery, causing permanent injury to a 22-year-old woman's eyelids using unapproved fillers.
Wang also faces charges for misrepresenting herself to obtain loans and falsely advertising medical credentials, prosecutors say.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda broke down on train tracks in Abington and was hit by an MBTA train.
The incident occurred around 8 p.m. on Sunday near Plymouth St., Transit Police reported.
The 35-year-old driver exited the vehicle before the collision; no injuries were reported.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman was hit and killed by a car on Route 28 in Wareham on Sunday night.
The woman and a man were walking on the highway because the sidewalk was covered in snow, officials said.
The vehicle's occupants remained at the scene; an investigation into the crash is ongoing, per the district attorney.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Alexander Aiello, 37, a former Gloucester police officer, sentenced to 4 years in prison for child pornography charge.
Search of Aiello's home revealed a USB drive with over 200 files of child sexual abuse material.
Aiello, identified as a user of a child porn website, visited it multiple times between 2024 and 2025.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Seven are presumed dead after the Gloucester-based fishing boat Lily Jean sank off Cape Ann's coast.
The U.S. Coast Guard located a debris field and an unoccupied life raft, confirming one unresponsive body found.
The Coast Guard and National Transportation Safety Board will investigate the accident; the probe expected to take months.

title: Why readers think Bill Belichick belonged in the Hall of Fame this year
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: 93% of over 450 Boston.com readers think Bill Belichick should have been in the Hall of Fame this year.
Bill Belichick has eight Super Bowl wins, but did not receive enough votes for first-ballot Hall of Fame induction.
Some readers cite Patriots-era scandals as factors against Belichick's Hall of Fame candidacy despite his coaching success.

title: Which Patriots Super Bowl will you never forget?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com invites readers to share their most memorable New England Patriots Super Bowl moments for an upcoming article.
The Patriots' legendary plays include Adam Vinatieri's game-winning field goal in 2002 and Malcolm Butler's interception against the Seahawks.
Readers can share their stories via a form or email, with submissions potentially featured in future Boston.com pieces.

title: This runner is raising awareness about stroke and heart disease
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Liz Lang, 48, from Jackson, NJ, will run the Boston Marathon to raise awareness of stroke and heart disease.
Lang began her health journey in 2006 after a heart arrhythmia diagnosis pushed her to embrace healthier lifestyle changes.
She is fundraising for Tedy’s Team, aiming to support research and outreach on stroke and heart disease awareness.
